etymology.description: semantic: 木(木) (mù, "tree") + phonetic: 耶(耶) (yē, a phonetic component) = a tree associated with the sound - coconut tree
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the 木(木) (mù, "tree") radical, indicating it is a type of tree, with 耶(耶) (yē) to suggest its pronunciation, forming the word for "coconut."

examples.chinese: 海边的椰子树(海邊的椰子樹)，摇曳生姿(搖曳生姿)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎibiān de yēzi shù, yáoyè shēngzī.
examples.english: The coconut trees by the sea sway gracefully.

examples.chinese: 在热带岛屿(在熱帶島嶼)，椰子很受欢迎(椰子很受歡迎)。
examples.pinyin: Zài rèdài dǎoyǔ, yēzi hěn shòu huānyíng.
examples.english: In tropical islands, coconuts are very popular.

examples.chinese: 我买了一颗椰子(我買了一顆椰子)。
